mods.note: 2 tifs. A black and white postcard of the Park in Pulaski, Tennessee. The image shows a large crows around a central square. A covered seating area is seen in the distance and houses are above the scene in the hills. The words Park, Pulaski, Tenn. is written in red ink above the photograph. The verso note reads, "Hello how are you by this time fine I guess I am alright. Address [unknown] Pulaski, Tn R#3 and I will get it [unknown] will have it to give and for [unknown] sooner. by by James Oakley." It was sent to Miss Jewell Shelby in Wood Lawn Tennessee, and the time stamp reads Pulaski, Tenn. May 14, 4pm. It was sent with a green Benjamin Frankin one cent stamp and printed in Germany.
The University of Tennessee Libraries (Knoxville, Tennessee) is the digital publisher.

titleInfo.title: Digital Collection: The Growth of Democracy in Tennessee: A Grassroots Approach to Volunteer Voices
